intro: Ribes glaciale var. angustisepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically red or yellow, which are used in local cuisines and traditional medicines. It thrives in cold, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine and tundra ecosystems.
